page.title: 09COMMUNICATIONS AT TEVIOTHEAD
page.content:
{TEVIOTHEAD,}BEING RURAL, IS POORLY SERVED WITH ONLY ONE POSTAL DELIVERY DAILY FROM HAWICK AND ONE COLLECTION OF MAIL FROM THE POST BOX. THE POSTMAN, WHO DRIVES A RED VAN, ALSO DELIVERS PAPERS FOR A SMALL CHARGE. MANY TAKE LETTERS TO A FARMHOUSE WHICH IS ALSO USED AS A{POST OFFICE.}HERE THEY CAN BUY STAMPS AND POST PARCELS.
MOST OF THE LARGER HOUSES AND SOME OF THE SMALLER ONES HAVE TELEPHONES. A {PUBLIC PHONE-BOX}IS NEAR THE SCHOOL AND TAKES 10P COINS. EMERGENCY CALLS ARE FREE, SO TOO ARE CALLS TO THE OPERATOR. THIS IS ESPECIALLY USEFUL IN SUCH A RURAL AREA WHERE THERE ARE NO SHOPS OR PUBLIC-HOUSES TO OBTAIN CHANGE. TELEPHONES ARE BEING USED INCREASINGLY IN RURAL AREAS TO CUT DOWN THE FEELING OF ISOLATION.
